list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a quiet place in the country
I spent my holiday in various different places.
There’s a place for your books on this shelf.

list_definition.mean_english: toà nhà hay khu vực dùng cho một mục đích cụ thể
list_definition.definition: an area or building with a particular purpose
a seat (in a theatre/theater, train, at a table etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He went to his place and sat down.

list_definition.definition: a position in an order, series, queue etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She got the first place in the competition
I lost my place in the queue.

list_definition.definition: a person’s position or level of importance in society etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Warriors rose to an important place in Aztec society.

list_definition.mean_english: chỗ đánh dấu trong cuốn sách
list_definition.definition: a point in the text of a book etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The wind was blowing the pages of my book and I kept losing my place.
It’s not my place to tell him he’s wrong.

list_definition.definition: a job or position in a team, organization etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He’s got a place in the team
He’s hoping for a place on the staff.

list_definition.definition: (often abbreviated to Pl.when written) a word used in the names of certain roads, streets or squares.

list_definition.mean_english: số con số sau dấu thập phân
list_definition.definition: a number or one of a series of numbers following a decimal point

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Make the answer correct to four decimal places.
He placed it on the table
He was placed in command of the army.

list_definition.definition: to remember who a person is

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I know I’ve seen her before, but I can’t quite place her.

list_ex_of_english: The speakers are placed in a position that allows the sound to bounce across the water surface.
Given that handfuls of debitage were placed directly into artifact bags in the field, all technologically diagnostic forms are well represented.
The first places all inequality constraints directly into a logarithmic barrier, leaving only explicit equality constraints.
The core feature of this review is that it places self-development at the centre of a definition of language teacher development.
The ethanol is placed in the indoor lower corridor and the acetone in the upper corridor.

The relative contributions of each of the constraints placed on the current data are at present unknown.
Most studies of financial development have placed primary emphasis on the provision of external finance.
